userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions. Any material to be used for publication requires the permission of the Special Collections Librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], WLU Coll 0248: Mary Coulling Papers, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University.

did.unittitle: CONTROL and lists of letters that Mrs. Coulling xeroxed
1824 - Letters from George and Julia R. Junkin.
1832 - Julia R. Junkin - First appearance of Margaret (March 20, June 4).
1833-1834 - Julia R., George, and Margaret Junkin
1836-37 Julia R. Also David X. Junkin (August 19).
1838 - Julia R. Junkin - Poem by Margaret
1839 - Margaret, poem and letters often to Helen Dickey, her cousin. Letter of Eleanor Junkin.
1840 - Letters of Eleanor, George, David X., Margaret, Julia Junkin.
1841 - Letters of Julia R., Margaret, Eleanor, George Junkin.
1844-45 - Eleanor, Margaret, Julia R., George Junkin.
1850-1952 - Margaret, Julia R. David X. Junkin.
1853 - Julia, Margaret, Poem to Ellie Junkin; Jackson, Thomas Jonathan Oct. 19, Nov. 30
1854 - George, Julia R. Young Julie Junkin, Margaret to T J Jackson Dec. 19. Ellie died in 1854. Sermon. Also Julia R. Junkin.
1855 - Correspondence between TJ Jackson and Margaret
1856 - Margaret, Julia Junkin; Fishburn, George and T J Jackson.
1861 -1862 - T J Jackson to Margaret; George, Margaret, David X.; August 21, 1862 letter from A. Lincoln to Margaret; Maggie Junkin Preston to Rebecca Glasgow, May 27, 1862
1863 - Letters from T J Jackson shortly before his death
1866-1870 - Mary Anna Jackson and Margaret Junkin Preston; Beginning of Margaret Junkin Preston's correspondence with Paul H. Hayne.
1876-1880 - Two originalsto Louisa Baxter from MJP. MJP/Hayne
1881-1884 - MJP/Hayne; 1882 - JTL Preston's poem to MJP on their 25th Anniversary.
1885-1886 - MJP/Hayne; Paul H. Hayne dies; MJP to T N Page and to Mrs. Hayne.
1887-1889 - MJP to a Prof. Bakervill (& others)
Coulling; index to the poetry of MJP
Poems not in scrapbooks or collected books.
Poems not in scrapbooks or collected books.
